revised_title: Genetic Instructions and Developmental Plasticity in the Kitten's Visual Cortex
tldr: The authors discuss the structural and functional aspects of plasticity in the kitten's visual cortex, focusing on the effects of monocular deprivation and early exposure to contours of one orientation. They find that the primary visual cortex of kittens has a basic organization of orientation columns and binocular cells, which can be altered by visual experience. Monocular deprivation causes a shift in ocular dominance, while exposure to specific orientations affects the distribution of preferred orientations in cortical neurons.
